articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Participants of Youth Meeting
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Participants of Youth Meeting
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, had a photo session with the participants in the 2nd National Meeting of Young Frontrunners in Noble Traits.
					 He met the participants of the meeting who distinguished themselves in displaying noble sense of obligation and beautiful moral traits for revolutionary forerunners and comrades with boundless loyalty to the Party and the leader and in the spirit of devoted service for the country and its people. Listening to their deeds one by one, he warmly encouraged them.
					
					 Such good deeds of young people who unhesitatingly dedicate even their lives to the Party and the country with the warm love for people can be seen only in our country where all its service personnel and people have formed a great harmonious family, he said, adding immensely rosy is the future of Songun Korea as it confidently advances toward the final victory, demonstrating its might as the only power of youth in the world.
					
					 Warmly congratulating the participants upon the successful meeting, he had a photo session with them.
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that the young people would fully demonstrate their heroic spirit and wisdom as the Korean youth by performing proud feats in all worksites for building a prosperous country like the revolutionary forerunners who unhesitatingly dedicated their youth and lives to the party and the leader and like the generation of their fathers and mothers who remained true to the Party's call.
					
					 Accompanying him were Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Il Hwan and Jon Yong Nam.

articles.title: Greetings to Guyanese President-elect
articles.content:
Greetings to Guyanese President-elect
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to David Arthur Granger, president-elect of the Cooperative Republic of Guyana.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger, sincerely wishing him success in his responsible work for the development of the country and the wellbeing of the people.

articles.title: Venezuelan President to Boost Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Venezuelan President to Boost Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador Ri Sung Gil presented his credentials to Nicolas Maduro Moros, president of Venezuela, on May 11.
					 The president said Venezuela and DPRK are far away from each other geographically but they have fraternal relations as they have always supported and cooperated with each other in the efforts for building socialism against imperialism.
					
					 The two countries have deepened mutual understanding through high-ranking visits and contacts, closely cooperated with each other in the international arena and the bilateral relations developed onto a higher stage in this course, he added.
					
					 He called for supporting and cooperating with each other in order to steadily develop the bilateral relations onto a fresh higher stage and continuing to join hands in the struggle for independence and socialism against imperialism.

articles.title: Participants of Youth Meeting Help Major Construction Projects
articles.content:
Participants of Youth Meeting Help Major Construction Projects
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 2nd National Meeting of Young Frontrunners in Noble Traits rendered labor assistance to major construction projects in Pyongyang on Sunday.
					 They helped builders at construction sites of Mirae Scientists Street and the Sci-Tech Complex, carrying building materials.

articles.title: DPRK Will Continue Developing Powers Deterrence for Self-Defence: Minju Joson
articles.content:
DPRK Will Continue Developing Powerful Deterrence for Self-Defence: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet groups is pulling up the DPRK over its recent underwater test-fire of ballistic missile from a strategic submarine, terming it a "violation of UNSC resolution" and "serious challenge". The chief executive of south Korea in a recent meeting of puppet ministers of foreign affairs and security made much fuss, taking emergency measures.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Sunday says:
					
					 The sovereignty and dignity of the countries and nations are useless if they have not powerful deterrence for self-defence.
					
					 It is the vital issue directly linked with the destiny of the nation and the greatest state affair for the DPRK to bolster up nuclear deterrence for self-defence as it has made the revolution and construction despite the U.S. imperialists' nuclear and threat for decades.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the DPRK's nuclear deterrence for self-defence serves as the almighty treasured sword greatly contributing to peace and security not only on the Korean peninsula but in Northeast Asia.
					
					 A particular mention should be made of the fact that it is irrefutable that if the ballistic missiles from strategic submarines are to go on a serial production and be deployed in a near future, peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in Northeast Asia will be consolidated so much.
					
					 The puppet group's talking about emergency measures and "responding proposals" is nothing but a poor trick to invent a pretext and excuse for igniting a nuclear war against the DPRK in league with the U.S.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK will never pardon such attempt of the warmongers but continue developing Korean-style powerful deterrence for self-defence and deal a deadly sledge-hammer at the provocateurs and aggressors.
					
					 The puppet group would be well advised to act with discretion, bearing deep in mind that the military nexus with the U.S. will bring a final ruin.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Puppet Forces' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Puppet Forces' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The south Koran puppet group in a recent UN "seminar on human rights in north Korea" in the U.S. malignantly slandered the dignified social system of the DPRK. Meanwhile, it is working hard to railroad the "bill on human rights in the north" through the "National Assembly".
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article says in this regard:
					
					 The anti-DPRK "human rights" racket is a criminal act of treachery to realize the ambition of "unification of social systems" while standing against the national reconciliation, unity and independent reunification. 
					
					 It is also a total denial of the idea and social system of the DPRK and a vicious politically-motivated provocation against it.
					
					 Though the people-centered socialist system of our own style is the most advantageous, we do not force it on south Korea and have never done so. If one's own idea and social system are to be forced on the other, it will bring about confrontation and war only.
					
					 That is why the DPRK urged the south Korean authorities not to seek the "unification of social systems" fanning up distrust and conflict between the north and the south and stop insulting the social system of the other party and asking other countries to do harm to the compatriots.
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities, however, are working hard to stifle the DPRK in league with foreign forces, malignantly slandering the idea and social system of the DPRK under the pretext of "human rights". This is a mockery and insult to the genuine human rights and a total denial and challenge to the dignified socialist system of the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces' anti-DPRK "human rights" racket is unworkable and will bring them ruin.

articles.title: Swiss Bodies Assail U.S.-Japan Military Alliance for Aggression
articles.content:
Swiss Bodies Assail U.S.-Japan Military Alliance for Aggression
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on May 10 in protest against the moves of the U.S. and Japanese reactionaries to intensify their military alliance for aggression.
					 The statement said:
					
					 On April 27 the U.S. and the Japanese reactionaries revised the "defense cooperation guidelines."
					
					 This scenario for aggression and war allows the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" to enter south Korea not only in contingency but in peacetime and conduct joint military operations for aggression with the U.S. forces present in south Korea.
					
					 Pursuant to it, the Japanese reactionaries have become to take part in a nuclear war against the DPRK and justify the exercise of the "right to collective self-defense."
					
					 The pro-U.S., pro-Japanese Park Geun Hye conservative group of south Korea has zealously patronized it, revealing once again its true colors as a henchman of Japan.
					
					 To kowtow to the U.S. and Japan, the sworn enemies of the Korean nation, is a criminal act of treachery.
					
					 The heroic army and people of the DPRK will never pardon this.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se fotografia con participantes en conferencia de vanguardias de jovenes en conductas loables
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se fotografia con participantes en conferencia de vanguardias de jovenes en conductas loables
Pyongyang, 17 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, se fotografio junto con los participantes en la 2a conferencia nacional de los vanguardias de jovenes en conductas loables.
					Dos jovenes de ambos sexos entregaron ramos de flores al Mariscal quien llego al lugar de filmacion.
					
					Antes de tomar fotos, el Mariscal se reunio con los participantes quienes demostraron conductas ejemplares en poner de pleno manifiesto ilimitada fidelidad al partido y al lider, el espiritu de abnegado servicio a la patria y al pueblo, la noble obligacion a los revolucionarios predecesores y camaradas y el hermoso temperamento moral y les estimulo cordialmente escuchando atentamente las conductas de ellos.
					
					Las conductas de nuestros jovenes, quienes saben dedicar sin vacilacion alguna hasta su vida para el partido y la patria y amar cordialmente al ser humano, pueden hallarse solo en nuestro pais que se ha convertido en una gran familia armoniosa, senalo y prosiguio que es radiante el futuro de la Corea del Songun que avanza con vigor hacia la victoria final ostentandose como una potencia de juventud sin par en el mundo.
					
					El Mariscal felicito calurosamente a los participantes quienes efectuaron con exito la conferencia y tomo fotos de recuerdo junto con ellos.
					
					Manifesto la esperanza y conviccion de que todos los jovenes pondran de pleno manifiesto el heroico impetu e inteligencia de la juventud de Corea al registrar las grandes  proezas en todos los campos de construccion de la patria prospera al igual que los martires revolucionarios quienes lucharon dedicando sin vacilacion su juventud y vida para el partido y el lider y como la generacion de sus padres y madres quienes acudieron a porfia a los montes, mares y otras zonas nuevas en pleno acato al llamamiento del partido.
					
					Le acompanaron en la ocasion Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Il Hwan y Jon Yong Nam.
